result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier C Scaife was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. If unpaid, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. PAYMENT PLAN OF $50/MONTH TO BEGIN ON DECEMBER 1, 2022.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If unpaid, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. PAYMENT PLAN OF $50/MONTH TO BEGIN ON DECEMBER 1, 2022.

10:54 AM Defendant Xavier C Scaife in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Xavier C Scaife.  Attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  State files an amended information in 22CF92. Reading waived, ng plea entered.  Upon plea to Ct. 1 in 22CF92 the State would recommend a fine $500 plus court costs, plea to Ct. 2 in 22CF697 the State would recommend a fine of $500 plus court costs.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  Parties make sentencing arguments. Defendant speaks on his own behalf.

records.addlTxt: atty Preston
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Xavier C Scaife appeared by video, in custody, Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Xavier C Scaife. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Initial appearance on January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
